intro: Tarchonanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth tarchonanthus, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, cylindrical heads, which are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. The smooth tarchonanthus is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
